jobs.title: Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer
jobs.description:
Chief Financial \& Operating Officer (CFO/COO)

**Location:** Dallas, TX (Hybrid Position)  
**Reports to:** Founder / Principal  
**Type:** Full\-time preferred; part\-time considered for the right candidate

About Gas Lamp Design

Gas Lamp Design is a growing interior design studio specializing in multifamily and boutique hospitality projects. We are design\-driven, detail\-oriented, and deeply invested in building a sustainable, scalable business that supports creative excellence. We are seeking a CFO/COO to serve as a long\-term strategic partner to leadership and help guide the firm through its next phase of growth.

Role Overview

The CFO/COO is a senior leadership role responsible for the financial health, operational efficiency, and long\-term strategic planning of the firm. This individual will be deeply embedded in the business and actively involved in day\-to\-day operations as well as high\-level strategy.

**This is not a fractional or advisory\-only role.** While we are open to a **part\-time arrangement for the right candidate**, we are seeking someone who is committed to the firm, understands our business intimately, and can grow with us over time.

Key Responsibilities: **Financial Leadership \& Strategy**

* Serve as a strategic advisor to the Founder/Principal on financial and operational decisions
* Develop and oversee firm\-wide financial strategy, including long\-term projections, cash flow planning, and growth scenarios
* Create and manage annual budgets, forecasts, and financial models
* Monitor firm profitability by project, client, and service type (design fees, procurement, etc.)
* Provide regular financial reporting and insights to leadership (monthly, quarterly, annual)

Accounting \& Compliance

* Oversee day\-to\-day accounting operations and manage the in\-house bookkeeper
* Ensure accurate and timely monthly close and financial statements
* Manage all tax planning, filings, and deadlines (federal, state, payroll, sales/use tax, etc.)
* Coordinate with external CPAs, tax advisors, and auditors as needed
* Maintain strong internal controls and compliance practices

Procurement \& Project Financials

* Oversee financial systems related to FF\&E procurement, including cash flow timing, vendor payments, and client billing
* Ensure proper tracking and reconciliation of procurement revenue, cost of goods, and margins
* Support project teams with fee structures, billing schedules, and financial performance tracking
* Improve systems for managing retainers, reimbursables, and phased billing

Operations \& Process Improvement

* Lead process improvement initiatives to increase efficiency across finance, operations, and project workflows
* Evaluate and optimize financial, project management, and procurement systems/tools
* Establish scalable processes that support growth while maintaining flexibility
* Partner with leadership to align operations with firm culture and design priorities

Business Growth \& Leadership

* Support strategic growth initiatives, including hiring, new service offerings, and geographic expansion
* Develop KPIs and dashboards to track firm performance
* Help shape firm policies related to contracts, pricing, risk management, and operations
* Act as a steady, trusted leader who brings clarity, accountability, and momentum

Qualifications

* CPA required
* 10\+ years of progressive financial and operational leadership experience
* Proven experience helping grow and scale a small business
* Prior experience in an architecture, interior design, or professional services firm strongly preferred
* Deep understanding of project\-based accounting and procurement workflows
* Strong financial modeling, budgeting, and forecasting skills
* Experience managing staff and external consultants
* Proactive, solutions\-oriented mindset with a high level of ownership
* Excellent communication skills and ability to partner with creative leadership

Why Join Gas Lamp Design

* Key leadership role with real influence over the firm’s future
* Close partnership with founder and leadership team
* Opportunity to build and refine systems, processes, and strategy
* Creative, collaborative environment with a strong design ethos
* Competitive compensation and benefits commensurate with experience

Job Types: Full\-time, Part\-time

Pay: From $100,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Dallas, TX 75214

jobs.title: Fractional CFO
jobs.description:
Dear Future CFO of BostonSpeaks,

Let’s be clear from the start.

This is not a traditional CFO role.

**BostonSpeaks** is looking for a **modern, heart\-centered Fractional CFO** who enjoys being part of a team and wants to grow *with* the company

At BostonSpeaks, we help leaders overcome public speaking anxiety, and we bring that same depth, honesty, and humanity into how we work together.

**We’re looking for someone who:**

* Values human connection as much as performance
* Resonates with a culture of openness, self\-awareness, and growth
* Believes numbers should create clarity, confidence, and freedom — not fear

**About the Role**

You’ll act as a strategic financial partner to our leadership team as BostonSpeaks continues to grow. Your role is to bring clarity, structure, and stability in a way that feels supportive, human, and empowering.

**You’ll enjoy this role if you:**

* Love translating numbers into **plain\-English decisions**
* Are energized by **small, purpose\-driven teams**
* Use modern tools and systems and have opinions about them
* Are comfortable challenging leadership with clarity and kindness
* Enjoy teaching leaders how to think financially, not just reporting numbers
* Want to lead and shape the finance function as the company evolves

**What You’ll Focus On**

* Cash flow, forecasting, and financial visibility
* Budgets aligned with company goals
* Scalable systems and automations (QuickBooks, Wise, Monday)
* Clear, simple financial processes that support sustainable growth

**Culture \& Fit**

Culture is not a side note at BostonSpeaks, it’s the foundation.

You’ll feel at home here if you:

* Believe growth starts from within and are willing to question your own assumptions
* Value authentic communication and real conversations
* Care deeply about the quality of the work *and* how it feels to do it
* Believe finance can be both **structured and heart\-centered**

How to Apply

If this resonates, we’d love to get to know you.  
Email **sophie@bostonspeaks.com** with:

A loom/sendspark/… video introducing yourself, telling us

* Why are you interested in working with BostonSpeaks?
* Your experience in finance and leadership roles
* Why do you think you would be a good cultural fit for our company?
* What are your expectation

Assume BostonSpeaks currently generates $1\.4M annual revenue with $280,000 profit. Our 1\-year goal is to reach $2\.1M annual revenue with a 30% profit margin. With only this information:

* What would be the first questions you would ask to understand our business financially?
* What areas would you focus on first in this role? (Top 3 priorities)
* (High\-level is fine; we’re evaluating your thinking, not precision.)

What Happens Next?

Once we review your message, we’ll reach out if we believe you’re a great fit for the role.Our process typically includes a short discovery call followed by a second interview with Hayleigh and Kit, our COO and CEO.

\-Team BostonSpeaks  
p.s. if you apply, please address it to Sophie who will be managing our conversations.

Job Type: Part\-time

Pay: $1,500\.00 \- $2,000\.00 per month

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO)
jobs.description:
**Job Overview**

The Brown Group is a growing, multi\-entity organization operating across real estate, fitness, automotive, hospitality, and development projects. We are seeking an execution\-focused Fractional CFO to bring immediate financial structure, visibility, and accountability to the business.

This role is hands\-on and operational, not advisory only. The ideal candidate is comfortable stepping into a fast\-moving environment, cleaning up financials, and building repeatable systems.

Key Responsibilities

* Reconcile bank accounts across multiple entities
* Produce accurate P\&L, Balance Sheet, and cash flow reports
* Implement and manage a weekly cash flow reporting process
* Establish and enforce a monthly close schedule
* Oversee and assess existing accounting staff and workflows
* Recommend and assist in hiring bookkeepers or accounting clerks
* Ensure financial accuracy, controls, and consistency
* Prepare lender\-ready financial packages
* Support refinancing, credit facilities, and development financing
* Partner directly with the Founder \& CEO on financial strategy and decisions

Required Qualifications

* 10\+ years of finance or accounting leadership experience
* Previous Fractional CFO or senior Controller experience
* Strong background in multi\-entity accounting
* Real estate accounting experience required
* Proven experience cleaning up disorganized or incomplete books
* Proficient with QuickBooks or similar accounting systems
* Highly organized, deadline\-driven, and decisive

Preferred Experience

Founder\-led or entrepreneurial businesses

* Property management, development, or construction accounting
* Operating companies (fitness, automotive, hospitality, retail)
* Banking, lender reporting, and debt support

What This Role Is Not

* Not an advisory\-only position
* Not a passive oversight role
* Not a bookkeeping\-only position

We are seeking a leader who executes and delivers results quickly.

What Success Looks Like

* Timely, accurate, lender\-ready financial reporting
* Clear and consistent cash flow visibility
* A structured and accountable accounting function
* Reduced dependency on the Founder for financial oversight

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $6,000\.00 \- $10,000\.00 per month

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Fractional CFO/Controller (Small Business) Lansing Area
jobs.description:
**Nienhuis Financial Group** is a rapidly growing accounting firm committed to delivering excellence in fractional and managerial accounting services. Our client base includes private companies with between $1\-75M in revenue, varies in industry, and includes Not\-For\-Profit and For Profit. With a dedicated team and a strong focus on communication, accuracy and timeliness, we strive to exceed client expectations. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a skilled **Fractional CFO/Controller focused on small business** to build and maintain relationships with clients, provide financials, controller services and ensure compliance with accounting principles.

 **To be successful for this role, you will have:**  

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong business acumen
* Extensive knowledge of general financial accounting and cost accounting
* Strong technical and inter\-personal leadership
* Ability to lead teams including coaching, delegation, and performance management
* Highly proficient with accounting software
 **Education and/or Experience**  

* BA in accounting, business administration, business management, or other related field
* 10\+ years accounting experience
* 2\+ years supervisory or project lead experience
  

**Preferred Education and/or Experience**  

* MBA or master’s in accounting, or other related field
* 2\+ years client management experience
 **Helpful Software Experience**  

Microsoft Outlook Email, Calendar, Teams, Excel, Multifactor Authentication; VPN/Terminal Server, QuickBooks Online, LastPass, Zoom, Canopy, OneDrive, Google Suite, Chrome, Adobe DC, VoIP/3CX, SafeSend, BambooHR, TSheets, Documo, Divvy, Bill.com, Fathom, Gusto.

  

**Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:** CPA preferred  

**Supervisory Responsibilities**: May or may not supervise a small team

  

**Full time:** Salaried, Exempt

jobs.title: Fractional Financial Controller / CFO (Hospitality)
jobs.description:
**Part\-Time / Fractional — Miami (Hybrid)**

*About the Company*

Caracas Bakery is a growing, multi\-location bakery and café group based in Miami. We operate several locations with additional openings planned in 2026\. We are founder\-led, brand\-driven, and at a stage where **financial discipline and profitability** are the top priorities.

We are looking for a **hospitality\-experienced financial leader** to bring structure, clarity, and accountability to our numbers and help make each location profitable on a monthly basis.

The Role

This is a **fractional/part\-time role** (10–20 hours per week). You will work directly with the founder and leadership team to clean up financial reporting, improve margins, and build systems that support profitable growth.

This is **not** a bookkeeping role and **not** a corporate CFO seat. We are looking for someone hands\-on, analytical, and comfortable working inside a fast\-moving hospitality operation.

Key Responsibilities

* Produce clean **monthly P\&Ls by location**
* Analyze food cost, labor cost, and prime cost
* Identify margin leaks and operational inefficiencies
* Support menu pricing and menu engineering decisions
* Build and maintain cash flow forecasts
* Define break\-even points per location
* Create simple weekly and monthly financial dashboards
* Partner with operations leadership to improve profitability
* Coordinate with external accountant and payroll providers
* Prepare financial insights to support expansion decisions

What Success Looks Like

* Clear understanding of profitability **per location**
* Improved EBITDA within the first 90 days
* Reliable, timely financial reporting
* Actionable insights that operations can execute
* Founder and leadership no longer guessing about numbers

Requirements

* 7\+ years in finance or accounting
* **Hospitality experience required** (restaurants, bakeries, cafés, or multi\-unit F\&B)
* Experience supporting **multi\-location operations**
* Strong understanding of labor models and food cost control
* Comfortable working with POS and accounting systems (Square, Toast, QuickBooks, Restaurant365, etc.)
* Experience as a Controller, Finance Director, or Fractional CFO
* Direct, practical, and comfortable giving honest feedback

Nice to Have

* Experience helping turn around underperforming locations
* Experience working with founder\-led businesses
* Background in menu engineering or cost optimization

Compensation

* Fractional engagement: **$75/hour to $125/hour**, depending on experience and time commitment
* Bonus potential tied to profitability improvement
* Flexible schedule

How to Apply

Please apply with:

* Resume
* Brief note explaining your **hospitality finance experience** and the types of businesses you’ve supported

Job Types: Contract, Temporary

Pay: $75\.00 \- $125\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Miami, FL 33137

jobs.title: Fractional CFO to Small Businesses
jobs.description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Fractional Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to partner with small businesses, providing expert financial leadership and strategic guidance.

*As part of our focus on helping our team and individuals maximize their superhuman powers, it is important we understand how to fully engage and develop our team players.* ***In addition to submitting your resume, please take 7\-8 minutes to complete a simple 2 question survey by clicking on the link below. THOSE WHO COMPLETE THE SURVEY and provide their resume, will be given priority in the interview process.***

***https://go.cultureindex.com/s/9CYljeLab3***

This role is ideal for a proactive finance professional who thrives in a flexible, advisory capacity, helping organizations optimize their financial health, navigate complex accounting standards, and achieve sustainable growth. As a key strategic partner, you will deliver high\-impact insights, foster sound fiscal management practices, and support leadership teams in making informed decisions that drive success.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement comprehensive financial strategies aligned with clients’ business goals, ensuring robust fiscal management and sustainable growth.
* Lead financial planning, forecasting, budgeting, and analysis to provide clear insights into profit \& loss statements, cash flow, and financial health.
* Oversee corporate accounting functions including compliance with GAAP.
* Support mergers \& acquisitions activities through due diligence, valuation analysis, negotiation assistance, and integration planning.
* Provide expert guidance on cash management, expense control, cost management, supply chain finance, and revenue cycle management to optimize operational efficiency.
* Lead financial report writing and interpretation for senior leadership and board members to facilitate strategic decision\-making.
* Advise on business development initiatives by analyzing market trends, conducting market analysis, and identifying growth opportunities.
* Supervise financial software implementation and utilization to streamline accounting processes and improve data accuracy.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience as a CFO or senior finance leader with a strong background in small business environments; supervisory experience preferred.
* Extensive knowledge of financial concepts including profit \& loss management, budgeting, forecasting, cost control, expense management, and fiscal strategy development.
* Deep understanding of technical accounting standards such as GAAP is a plus.
* Demonstrated expertise in financial analysis, modeling, risk management, regulatory reporting, and corporate finance activities like mergers \& acquisitions.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to influence at all levels of an organization; excellent negotiation skills for business development opportunities.
* Proficiency in financial software systems and advanced Excel skills for complex financial modeling and analysis.
* Exceptional communication skills for clear report writing and interpretation of complex financial data to non\-financial stakeholders.
* Relevant certifications such as CPA (Certified Public Accountant), CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst), or CMA (Certified Management Accountant) are highly desirable. Join us in empowering small businesses through expert financial stewardship! This role offers the opportunity to make a tangible impact by guiding organizations toward long\-term success while leveraging your comprehensive knowledge of finance principles across diverse industries.

Pay: $80,000\.00 \- $106,713\.23 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) 4% Match
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and Culture Officer
jobs.description:
**Job Summary**

**Quentasia Studios**

Quentasia Studios is building a new model for premium, inclusive storytelling—one designed to be legible, auditable, and investable at institutional scale. As we prepare to scale into a multi\-slate entertainment studio, we are seeking a **Chief Financial Officer (CFO)** who is not only a rigorous financial operator, but a strategic partner capable of translating creative ambition into durable economic outcomes.

This role is for someone who understands that **financial discipline is not a constraint on creativity — it is the condition that makes creative freedom possible**.

Why This Role Matters

The CFO will be one of the most critical architects of Quentasia’s future.

This role will directly influence:

* How capital is raised, structured, and protected
* How investors experience transparency and trust
* How creative projects are financed without compromising values
* How Quentasia earns credibility with institutional allocators

This is an opportunity to help build a studio that treats finance not as a back\-office function, but as a core strategic capability.

Key ResponsibilitiesCapital Strategy \& Investor Stewardship

* Co\-lead capital raising across equity, debt, and strategic partnerships.
* Represent Quentasia in conversations with family offices, institutions, banks, and strategic capital partners.
* Design capital structures that balance risk, flexibility, and long\-term value creation.
* Partner with the CEO in articulating Quentasia’s financial narrative to investors and stakeholders.

Financial Strategy, Modeling \& Governance

* Design and maintain financial models for the studio and slate, including project cash flows, recoupment waterfalls, and return scenarios.
* Establish clear financial guardrails that enable growth while protecting downside risk.
* Build systems that allow investors to understand performance, not just projections.

Systems, Controls \& Transparency

* Build and oversee robust financial systems, controls, and reporting frameworks.
* Ensure compliance with accounting standards, internal controls, and risk management protocols.
* Partner with internal and external stakeholders to ensure financial data is accurate, timely, and decision\-useful.

Production Finance \& Structural Oversight

* Oversee project\-level financing structures, including SPVs, tax incentives, payroll, and union/guild compliance.
* Ensure production finance decisions align with both investor expectations and creative realities.
* Coordinate with production accounting teams to ensure consistency and discipline across projects.

Strategic Partnership with the CEO

* Serve as the CEO’s closest partner in evaluating trade\-offs between growth, capital deployment, and long\-term sustainability.
* Provide clear, principled counsel in moments of ambiguity or pressure.
* Help shape the long\-term operating model of the studio as it scales.

Culture, Integrity \& Financial Leadership

* Uphold Quentasia’s values in all financial dealings.
* Model integrity, clarity, and accountability in decision\-making.
* Lead with both rigor and humanity, recognizing that finance is ultimately about stewarding trust.

Ideal Candidate Profile

* Senior finance leader with experience in entertainment, media, private equity, or complex operating environments.
* Demonstrated track record in capital raising and structuring sophisticated financial transactions.
* Deep experience building financial systems, controls, and reporting infrastructure.
* Strong understanding of US GAAP, IFRS, production finance, tax incentives, and unionized workforces is highly valued.
* Comfortable operating in a lean, evolving organization while building for scale.
* High emotional intelligence, strong communication skills, and investor presence.
* A principled operator who believes finance exists to enable excellence, not restrict it.

Engagement Structure

Because Quentasia is in a pre\-funding and early scaling phase, this role will begin as:

* Advisory or fractional, transitioning to full\-time as financing milestones are achieved
* Active participation in capital strategy and leadership formation
* Advisory equity participation to reflect early belief and contribution
* Full compensation package (salary \+ equity) activated post\-funding

Candidates must be willing to sign a non\-binding **Letter of Intent (LOI)** confirming interest in being identified as part of Quentasia’s founding leadership circle.

The Opportunity

Most studios hire CFOs to manage budgets.

At Quentasia, you will help design the financial system that makes ambitious, values\-aligned storytelling sustainable at scale.

You will help build a studio where capital is disciplined, transparency is non\-negotiable, and financial leadership is a source of strength — for creators, investors, and the company alike.

Pay: $225,000\.00 \- $250,000\.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to begin this role in an advisory capacity, with compensation in the form of equity until funding is secured?
* Are you comfortable participating in early leadership discussions and senior\-team selection prior to full funding?
* Are you willing to sign a non\-binding Letter of Intent (LOI) confirming interest in a future leadership role and allowing us to present your name and resume to investors?
* Do you understand that this opportunity is pre\-funding and does not include salary or benefits at the initial advisory stage?

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Fractional CFO and CPA
jobs.description:
**Company Overview**  
ECOJOHN is a pioneering manufacturer specializing in off\-grid waste management and water processing solutions, committed to delivering high\-quality, durable products for remote applications worldwide. Our innovative technology supports clients ranging from residential to large\-scale government and military operations, emphasizing sustainability and reliability.

**Fractional CFO / CPA (Retainer\-Based)**

**About the Role**

Ecojohn is seeking an experienced Fractional CFO / CPA to provide ongoing financial leadership, accounting oversight, and strategic planning on a retainer basis. This role is ideal for a hands\-on financial professional who can manage core accounting functions while also supporting leadership with cash flow management, financial modeling, and long\-term planning.

You will work closely with the executive team to strengthen financial systems, improve visibility into performance, and support Ecojohn’s continued growth in domestic and international markets.

**Key Responsibilities**

Accounting \& Bookkeeping

\- Oversee and/or manage monthly bookkeeping (QuickBooks)

\- Ensure accurate general ledger, reconciliations, and journal entries

\- Review AP/AR processes, inventory accounting, and COGS

\- Prepare and review monthly financial statements (P\&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)

\- Maintain GAAP\-compliant accounting practices

Cash Flow \& Financial Planning

\- Develop and maintain rolling cash flow projections

\- Monitor burn rate, liquidity, and working capital needs

\- Improve forecasting tied to production schedules and sales pipeline

\- Identify cost controls, margin improvements, and pricing insights

CFO\-Level Strategic Support

\- Build financial models, budgets, and multi\-scenario forecasts

\- Support capital planning, equipment investments, and growth initiatives

\- Provide financial insight for new product lines and market expansion

\- Prepare financial reporting for lenders, investors, or strategic partners

\- Advise leadership on financial risks and opportunities

Tax \& Compliance (CPA)

\- Prepare or coordinate federal and state tax filings

\- Ensure proper sales tax compliance across multiple states

\- Support year\-end close and audit readiness

\- Provide proactive tax planning and compliance guidance

Qualifications

\- Active CPA license (required)

\- 10\+ years of accounting and finance experience

\- Experience as a Fractional CFO, Controller, or CFO

\- Strong understanding of manufacturing accounting and inventory

\- Proven expertise in cash flow forecasting and financial modeling

\- Proficient in QuickBooks

\- Strong communication skills with non\-financial stakeholders

Preferred Experience

jobs.title: PACE Controls/PACE AI: Fractional Controller (Hybrid)
jobs.description:
**About PaceControls/PACE AI**

PaceControls is a machine learning and smart edge technology company focused on building smarter infrastructure. Our proven, scalable solutions for Smart Grid, Smart Buildings, and Smart Cities help reverse climate change, build better infrastructure, and deliver active risk management. We're growing rapidly and working with global partners to scale our impact.

**Position Overview**

We are seeking an experienced and detail\-oriented hybrid (in office 2\-3 days/week) Fractional Controller to join our finance team in Princeton, New Jersey. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will partner with our accounting team to strengthen financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and support strategic business decisions through accurate financial management and reporting.

This is a fractional role ideal for an experienced financial professional familiar with managerial accounting seeking flexible engagement with a growing technology company that will provide a gateway to a future FTE role.

**Key Responsibilities**

· Oversee the accounting function and work closely with the CFO and accounting staff to manage the company's financial operations.

· Ensure accurate and timely financial reporting in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles and all applicable regulations.

· Develop and implement accounting policies and procedures to enhance operational efficiency and internal controls.

· Prepare and analyze financial statements, budgets, and forecasts to support management decision\-making.

· Manage the general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and payroll processes.

· Conduct reconciliations of balance sheet accounts and investigate discrepancies.

· Familiarity with selecting and/or implementing financial/accounting software packages (e.g. Oracle Financials, QB professional, Hyperion, Alvalara, etc.)

· Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals.

· Assist with financial planning, cash flow management, and working capital optimization.

· Manage relationship with bank and external accountants.

· Negotiate credit and/or payment terms with vendors.

· Mentor and support the accounting team in their professional development.

**Required Qualifications**

· Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field, with certification as a CPA, CMA, or CIA preferred.

· 5 or more years of experience as a Controller, Controller, or in a similar senior accounting leadership role.

· Possess strong knowledge of US GAAP and financial reporting standards.

· Demonstrate expertise in accounting software systems and advanced proficiency with Excel.

· Solid experience with budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.

· Exhibit strong communication skills and the ability to translate financial information for non\-financial audiences.

· You are based in New Jersey and willing to work from a New Jersey location.

**Preferred Qualifications**

· Experience in technology, cleantech, or infrastructure sectors.

· Experience with venture\-backed or rapidly scaling companies.

· Familiarity with internal audit functions and SOX compliance.

· Knowledge of multi\-entity accounting and consolidation processes.

**“What We Offer”**

· Flexible, fractional arrangement with defined scope and expectations.

· Competitive compensation based on experience and engagement level.

· Opportunity to work with a mission\-driven team focused on climate and sustainability impact.

· Exposure to machine learning and smart infrastructure technology.

· Collaborative relationship with experienced CFO and accounting team.

Pay: $75\.00 \- $120\.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10\.0 – 40\.0 per week

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Princeton, NJ 08542

jobs.description:
**CFO Consultant**

Christy Paddock Advisors, LLC is continuing to grow and has a new opening for a qualified and experienced accounting professional to join our team as a CFO Consultant. Christy Paddock Advisors has been in business since 2016, assisting organizations throughout the greater Indianapolis area with their finance and accounting needs.

This position will join our team of professionals to provide accounting and reporting services to various clients. As a consultant, you will work closely with business owners and finance teams to help them streamline processes, close and reconcile their books, manage cash, provide timely and accurate reporting, and work toward the company’s financial goals. We also help businesses buy and sell companies and complete interim, project, and assessment\-based work.

Our consultants work normal business hours, experience a variety of industries, and leverage their natural curiosities and skills to make a difference. Growth and promotions are based on ability and how fast someone wants to learn, not waiting for someone to retire. Our staff is comprised of highly skilled, quick learners, with great personalities. We enjoy our work, are excited about opportunities, and have fun!

**Responsibilities:**

* Act as trusted financial advisor to CEOs/founders/leadership: develop strategy, monitor financial health, and drive performance improvement.
* Oversee or guide the finance function of client engagements: budgeting, forecasting, cash‑flow management, KPI dashboards.
* Implement or enhance financial controls, reporting systems and processes.
* Conduct financial and operational analysis: identify cost savings, revenue opportunities, and efficiency gains.
* Support funding rounds, acquisitions, or exit planning where applicable.
* Work across multiple client engagements simultaneously, managing scope, timelines and deliverables.
* Build relationships with clients, understand their business model, and tailor solutions accordingly.

**Qualifications:**

* A minimum of 8 years of senior accounting experience, with at least 2 years of this in public accounting, is strongly preferred. Prior CFO, or similar, experience is a plus.
* A CPA and/or MBA is strongly preferred
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling (three‑statement models, scenario planning, breakeven/risk/sensitivity analysis).
* Proven track record of improving financial performance, streamlining operations, and advising executive teams.

* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills—able to present complex financial information to non‑finance executives.
* Ability to work independently in a remote/fractional consulting structure, managing multiple engagements and priorities. Ability to also work as part of a team.

Our Core Focus: Provide leadership with the financial information needed to confidently make educated business decisions.

Core Values: Entrepreneurial Minded \| Trusted Business Partner \| Problem Solver \| Professional yet Approachable

jobs.title: Fractional CFO _ Emerging Technologies Practice
jobs.description:
### **Description**

 **What does it mean to be a Fractional CFO within the Escalon team?**
As a fractional CFO you could spend a few hours a month up to full time availably applying your technical and account management skill set across a variety of clients and industries.  

**What You’ll Do:**

The primary objective of the Fractional CFO within our Emerging Technologies Practice is to oversee enterprise accounting and provide financial information about client company’s activities that will assist the client and its shareholders in making economic company decisions. This position is proactive and solution oriented, offering depth of experience to our clients in the fast\-paced world of start\-up accounting.

This position will afford you a high degree of flexibility, the ability to focus on CFO\-level work (with a US and global team who will handle the bookkeeping and transactional accounting), an opportunity to work with exciting companies, and a support network of experienced financial professionals.

We are looking for stellar CFOs who have the experience, skills and desire to support a diverse and intriguing mix of businesses while building and managing strong client relationships. If you are ready to work with cutting\-edge startup companies, founders, investors and stakeholders focused on results, this opportunity is designed for you.  

**Day\-to\-Day Responsibilities also include:*** Primary responsibility and ownership for overall engagement level relationship with the client
* Provide insightful and trusted counsel to client business leadership and internal engagement team on both financial and broad\-based business issues related to the overall performance of the client company.
* Serve as a consulting member of the client leadership team in providing advice regarding the financial implications of all major client business decisions, as well as strategic input to shape client business objectives.
* Direct the work of accounting and financial planning team in all financial reporting including the provision of comprehensive monthly financial statements, and the development of forecasts and budgets respectively.
* Enable aligned direction and value creation through effective short and long\-range budgeting and forecasting
* Inform the client’s treasury function including optimizing cash flow
* Assist with strategies to capitalize the business, assisting to secure debt facilities and/or support fundraising activity.
* Identify opportunities for improvement, cost reduction, and systems enhancement.
* Manage external relationships with auditors and tax preparers and oversee risk management, including insurance.
* Oversee Corporate Governance and internal controls.
* Provide support on mergers and acquisitions and due diligence processes.
* Review and oversee client onboarding process to ensure company meets and exceeds client expectations.
* Create and nurture partnerships across functional roles within our organization including our OneShore team located in India

  

### **What You'll Bring**

  

**What You'll Bring**  

**Must Haves:*** 10\+ years in a financial role with 3\+ years as a CFO
* Active CPA
* **Token economics**. Strong understanding of and familiarity with token supply, vesting, staking rewards, inflation/deflation mechanics, etc.
* **On\-chain accounting**. Comfort with blockchain explorers, wallet structures, smart contracts, and reconciling on\-chain activity with off\-chain systems and financial statements. Experience with popular accounting subledgers a major plus.
* **Regulatory environment**. Experience operating in the ever\-evolving regulatory environment (SEC, CFTC, etc.), assessing risk around token classification, custody, revenue recognition, and disclosures.
* **Treasury management**. Some expertise in managing crypto and fiat treasuries, liquidity planning, and custody/security \- e.g., multi\-sig, key management.
* **Tax**. Knowledge of crypto\-specific tax issues (airdrop income, staking rewards, token swaps, etc.) and how they affect reporting and strategy.
* **Capital formation**. Familiarity with off\-shore entity formation, substance requirements, MSA/licensing structures, token launches, community allocations, DAO funding structures, etc.

### **More about us:**

  

Escalon Services is a Business Process Management (BPM) company that provides Essential Business Services (EBS) through a tech\-enabled platform to small\- and medium\-sized businesses (SMBs) and startups. The Company enables its clients to spend less time on "back office" functions and provides the value and insight that enables clients to spend more time focusing on delivering value and moving their businesses forward. With a US\-based remote workforce and global delivery team in India, Escalon’s solution fills a widening service gap in the SMB market, underpinned by (i) increasing demand for quality insights in an increasingly competitive marketplace (ii) decreasing supply of CPAs and quality in\-house talent and (iii) the cost frictions associated with scaling internal back\-office teams as businesses grow. For more information on Escalon: https://escalon.services/
Since founding, the company has executed both on an organic and M\&A strategy to expand service offerings and drive revenue expansion opportunity through cross\-sell/up\-sell. Before partnering with New Harbor Capital in late 2022, Escalon completed two significant acquisitions which tripled the revenue of the company and expanded the FinOps capabilities of the platform. Continued corporate development is a key value driver for the business going forward, with a highly fragmented market of service providers, often individually unable to scale due to lack of technology\-enablement and offshore capabilities.
In late 2022, New Harbor Capital made a growth equity investment in Escalon Services.  


About New Harbor Capital
New Harbor Capital is an experienced, lower middle\-market private equity firm that seeks to partner with growth\-minded, founder\-owned companies. Based out of Chicago, New Harbor Capital is committed to optimizing the growth potential of its portfolio companies while respecting their long\-term visions. The firm was founded on the belief that mutual respect and collaboration lead to successful outcomes. New Harbor recognizes the importance of finding the right partner, and the firm is committed to helping its portfolio companies and their leadership maximize both personal and financial goals.  


As a strategic partner, New Harbor taps into decades of experience to guide businesses through challenging economic cycles and market conditions. New Harbor Capital has raised over $750M in capital across three funds and focuses on tech\-enabled services, healthcare, and education services.### **About Escalon Services, LLC.**

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)
jobs.description:
**Luxury Concierge Medical Practice – New York City (Remote / Hybrid)**

**Job Type:** Contract / Part\-Time (Fractional)  
**Expected Hours:** 10–20 hours per week  
**Compensation:** $5,000–$8,000 per month \+ performance\-based incentives  
**Location:** Remote (NYC familiarity strongly preferred)

About the Role

We are seeking an experienced **Fractional Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)** to lead growth strategy and patient acquisition for a high\-end, physician\-led concierge medical practice based in New York City.

This is a **hands\-on leadership role** focused on building and optimizing predictable, ROI\-driven marketing systems for high\-ticket medical services. This position is ideal for a senior growth leader who prefers accountability, autonomy, and measurable outcomes over managing large teams.

Key Responsibilities

* Design and optimize end\-to\-end patient acquisition funnels (Meta / Google → CRM → consult → conversion)
* Own marketing strategy for high\-ticket services and concierge programs
* Oversee paid media performance, including Meta and Google Ads (strategy and accountability; not necessarily day\-to\-day buying)
* Optimize lead conversion through landing pages, CRM automations, SMS/email workflows, and scheduling flows
* Manage and hold external vendors accountable (SEO, creatives, media buyers)
* Track and report on core performance metrics including cost per booked consult, conversion rates, and revenue per lead
* Continuously test, iterate, and scale what works while eliminating underperforming efforts

What Success Looks Like

* Consistent flow of high\-intent booked consultations
* Predictable customer acquisition costs
* Clean attribution across marketing channels
* Scalable systems that do not rely on founders for execution
* Clear weekly performance reporting and actionable recommendations

Qualifications

**Required:**

* 7\+ years of experience in growth marketing, performance marketing, or marketing leadership
* Proven experience scaling high\-ticket services ($5,000\+ price points)
* Strong understanding of Meta Ads, Google Ads, and conversion optimization
* Experience building and managing CRM\-based funnels (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or similar)
* Comfortable owning KPIs tied to revenue and ROI

**Preferred:**

* Experience in medical, aesthetic, wellness, or luxury services
* Familiarity with concierge or membership\-based business models
* NYC or luxury market experience

This Role Is Not

* A branding\-only position
* A social media posting role
* An agency or outsourced vendor position
* An entry\-level or junior marketing role

This is a **strategic growth operator role**.

Compensation \& Structure

* Monthly retainer: **$5,000–$8,000**
* Performance incentives tied to revenue and growth milestones
* Flexible engagement structure with long\-term upside for strong performance

How to Apply

Please apply with:

* A brief summary of relevant growth initiatives you have led
* Specific metrics you have owned (e.g., CAC, conversion rates, revenue impact)
* Your availability and preferred engagement structure

Pay: $5,000\.00 \- $8,000\.00 per month

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10075

jobs.title: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) and Culture Officer
jobs.description:
**Job Summary**

Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) \& Cultural Officer

**Quentasia Studios**

Quentasia Studios is building a new model for premium, inclusive storytelling—one that recognizes audience, culture, and narrative as strategic assets, not afterthoughts. As we prepare to scale into a multi\-slate entertainment studio, we are seeking a **Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) \& Cultural Officer** who can translate mission into momentum and meaning into market impact.

This role is for a leader who understands that marketing is not just amplification—it is **architecture**: shaping how audiences find us, how partners understand us, and how culture experiences our work.

Why This Role Matters

The CMO \& Cultural Officer will play a defining role in how Quentasia is perceived, trusted, and embraced.

This role will directly influence:

* How Quentasia’s identity is articulated and protected
* How audiences discover and connect with our stories
* How cultural relevance translates into commercial value
* How partners, sponsors, and investors understand our market position

This is an opportunity to help architect the public\-facing voice of a studio that treats culture as infrastructure and audience trust as capital.

Key ResponsibilitiesBrand Leadership \& Narrative Stewardship

* Define and steward Quentasia’s brand narrative across studio, slate, and campaign levels.
* Ensure that storytelling, positioning, and messaging reflect Quentasia’s values, cultural commitments, and long\-term vision.
* Serve as a guardian of brand integrity as the company scales.

Audience Strategy \& Community Building

* Design and lead audience engagement strategies that prioritize authenticity, belonging, and long\-term loyalty.
* Build mission\-aligned communities across digital platforms, live events, and partnerships.
* Translate audience insight into actionable strategy across development, marketing, and distribution.

Integrated Marketing, PR \& Go\-to\-Market Strategy

* Lead integrated marketing and PR efforts spanning advertising, earned media, social, experiential, and platform partnerships.
* Guide go\-to\-market strategies for films, series, and campaigns in alignment with audience data and investor expectations.
* Balance cultural relevance with measurable performance outcomes.

Sponsorships, Partnerships \& Revenue Collaboration

* Collaborate with corporate sponsors, foundations, and cultural institutions to create aligned partnerships.
* Help shape sponsorship and brand integration strategies that respect creative integrity while driving revenue.
* Partner cross\-functionally to ensure marketing supports both commercial and mission\-driven goals.

Team Building \& Organizational Growth

* Build and lead a marketing organization that scales with the studio’s growth.
* Establish systems, workflows, and creative standards that enable consistency across multiple projects.
* Mentor and develop talent with an emphasis on inclusive leadership and creative excellence.

Ideal Candidate Profile

* Senior marketing leader with experience in entertainment, media, streaming, consumer brands, or cultural institutions.
* Demonstrated ability to build brands and communities with both cultural credibility and commercial impact.
* Proven success leading integrated campaigns and brand partnerships with clear ROI.
* Strong strategic instincts paired with hands\-on execution capability.
* Deep appreciation for culture, representation, and audience trust as strategic assets.
* Entrepreneurial mindset and comfort operating in a lean, evolving environment.
* A collaborative leader who can partner effectively with creative, finance, and executive leadership.

Engagement Structure

Because Quentasia is in a pre\-funding and early scaling phase, this role will begin as:

* Advisory or fractional, transitioning to full\-time as financing milestones are achieved
* Active participation in shaping studio identity, audience strategy, and leadership culture
* Advisory equity participation to reflect early belief and contribution
* Full compensation package (salary \+ equity) activated post\-funding

Candidates must be willing to sign a non\-binding **Letter of Intent (LOI)** confirming interest in being identified as part of Quentasia’s founding leadership circle.

The Opportunity

Most studios hire CMOs to promote content.

At Quentasia, you will help define how culture, audience, and commerce move together.

You will co\-create the identity and trajectory of a studio committed to storytelling that resonates deeply, travels widely, and endures—building trust with audiences while driving meaningful, sustainable growth.

Pay: $220,000\.00 \- $245,000\.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to begin this role in an advisory capacity, with compensation in the form of equity until funding is secured?
* Are you comfortable participating in early leadership discussions and senior\-team selection prior to full funding?
* Are you willing to sign a non\-binding Letter of Intent (LOI) confirming interest in a future leadership role and allowing us to present your name and resume to investors?
* Do you understand that this opportunity is pre\-funding and does not include salary or benefits at the initial advisory stage?

Work Location: In person

jobs.description:
**CMO Team Lead**

**Posted Job Title:** CMO Team Lead

**Location:** Hybrid work in Northville, MI

**Position Type:** Full\-time

Stealth is seeking a results\-driven CMO Team Lead with a specialized focus on managing the delivery of marketing performance and a team of Marketing Directors to join our team on a full\-time basis. Through our CMO\-led Fractional Marketing Program, you will tailor and provide strategic guidance, expert advice, and hands\-on support to optimize client marketing efforts, drive growth, and achieve business objectives. This role offers a unique opportunity to leverage your extensive marketing experience and management expertise to achieve our client’s growth goals.

Key Responsibilities

**Marketing Team Management**

* Manage Marketing Director level and above team members delivering strategic marketing guidance and execution of a client portfolio
* Provide expert insight and frameworks for budget and performance forecasting, go\-to\-market strategies, brand stories, vendor and executive management

**Marketing Strategy Management and Facilitation**

* Facilitate interactive whiteboard sessions with clients to diagnose complex issues and overcome roadblocks through a high energy experiential approach
* Present and explain marketing strategy plans to client decision makers
* Oversee the execution of agency vendors by scoping requests, reviewing and approving contracts, and holding them accountable to objectives through performance reviews
* Remove roadblocks, offer creative solutions, and a whatever it takes attitude towards hitting client growth objectives
* Work collaboratively with other team members to share ideas, overcome roadblocks, and keep a client’s marketing program on track
* Deliver top notch presentation decks in Google Slides for clients through writing, and pulling together any required image or visual assets
* Manage the creation of compelling Sales Decks and narratives for marketing and sales alignment
* Map out client’s customer journey workflows and identify areas for improvement in communication and efficiency
* Conduct in\-depth market analysis, competitor research, and customer segmentation to inform strategic decision\-making and identify growth opportunities
* Provide strategic guidance and recommendations on positioning, messaging, ad copy, target audience identification, and go\-to\-market strategies

**Marketing Audit and Assessment**

* Conduct thorough audits and provide improvement suggestions of clients' existing marketing efforts, including digital marketing, branding, content strategy, and marketing communications
* Analyze marketing performance metrics, KPIs, and ROI to identify strengths, weaknesses, and areas for optimization
* Deliver actionable insights and recommendations for enhancing marketing effectiveness, efficiency, and alignment with business objectives

**Marketing Technology Expertise**

* Guide Marketing Directors on the best ways to utilize marketing automation tools like Hubspot for workflow creation and customer nurturing, contact data importing, and campaign messaging
* Provide recommendations and scope project needs for our technology vendors to integrate systems, tracking, and implementing new tools to support marketing objectives
* Offer expertise in selecting and implementing marketing technology solutions that align with clients' business needs, budget, and resources

**Client Relationship Management**

* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, serving as a trusted advisor and strategic partner for their marketing initiatives
* Communicate effectively with clients to understand their goals, challenges, and priorities, and tailor marketing consulting services to meet their needs
* Evaluate client strategy plans and identify opportunities for expansion or evaluate and approve cases for resource reductions

Qualifications

* Minimum 10 years of experience as a Director or VP of Marketing
* Proven track record of success in driving marketing strategy, planning, and execution for clients across diverse industries and market segments.
* Demonstration of ability to create sales opportunity growth within both B2B and B2C companies with a minimum of $5M in annual revenue.
* Demonstration of ability to oversee and approve the completion of the integration of a marketing tech stack with tracking, reporting, and alignment to budget and performance goals.
* Strong familiarity with digital marketing channels, marketing technology, analytics, and best practices. Platforms include Google Analytics, Google Ads, and Facebook Ads Manager.
* Excellent consulting, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple client projects simultaneously and deliver results on time and within budget.
* Strong leadership skills, team building, and executive expectation setting required.
* Experience working in a fractional or consulting capacity is highly desirable.
* Experience working with businesses who run on EOS highly preferred.

Job Type: Full\-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Northville, MI 48167

jobs.title: Fractional Chief Revenue Officer (CRO)
jobs.description:
**About Plutus Health Inc.:**  

Plutus Health Inc. is a leading provider of Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) services with SOC2 Certification. We are dedicated to helping healthcare providers improve their financial performance. Our expertise spans across various specialties. We are committed to delivering exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients. As a result, **Plutus Health Inc. has been recognized on the 5000 list of the fastest\-growing private companies in America and ranked 100 in the Dallas area. Additionally, the company has been a 2024 finalist in the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year.**

  

Position Overview:
  

The Fractional Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) will be responsible for overseeing all revenue\-generating activities within Plutus Health Inc. This C\-suite executive will develop and implement strategies to increase sales, expand market presence, and maximize revenue opportunities. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in driving revenue growth within the healthcare or RCM industry.  

  

Key Responsibilities:  

  

1\. Revenue Growth Strategy:  

* Develop and execute comprehensive revenue generation strategies that align with the company’s overall goals.
* Identify new market opportunities and lead initiatives to capture additional market share.
* Drive sales growth through effective sales strategies, partnerships, and business development activities.

  

2\. Sales Leadership:  

* Lead, mentor, and develop the sales team to achieve and exceed revenue targets.
* Establish and monitor sales performance metrics, ensuring accountability and continuous improvement.
* Foster a high\-performance sales culture focused on customer satisfaction and revenue growth.

  

3\. Market Expansion:  

* Identify and evaluate new market segments and customer needs.
* Develop and implement strategies to enter new markets and expand the company’s footprint.
* Collaborate with marketing to create targeted campaigns that drive demand and brand awareness.

  

4\. Client Relationship Management:  

* Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients and partners.
* Ensure high levels of client satisfaction and retention.
* Develop strategies to upsell and cross\-sell services to existing clients.

  

5\. Revenue Operations:  

* Oversee the development and implementation of pricing strategies.
* Collaborate with finance to forecast revenue, set targets, and monitor performance against goals.
* Ensure the alignment of sales, marketing, and operations to drive revenue growth.

  

6\. Data\-Driven Decision Making:  

* Utilize data analytics to inform strategic decisions and optimize revenue\-generating activities.
* Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to stay ahead of the curve.
* Provide regular reports and updates to the executive team on revenue performance and opportunities.

  

Qualifications:  

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, or a related field.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in revenue generation roles, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership position.
* Proven track record of driving revenue growth in the healthcare or RCM industry.
* Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire high\-performing sales teams.
* Proficiency in CRM software and data analytics tools.

  

Why Plutus Health Inc.:  

  

* Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team.
* Play a key role in shaping the revenue strategy of a growing company.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.

Location: Oklahoma City, OK (Hybrid / On\-Site Preferred)

Initial Term: 90 days, with potential to transition to a full\-time executive role

**About The Brown Group**

The Brown Group is a diversified, founder\-led enterprise with operating companies across real estate, development, automotive, fitness, and consumer brands. We are entering a critical growth phase focused on operational discipline, financial clarity, and scalable execution.

We are seeking a Fractional Chief Business Officer (CBO) to serve as the Company’s Integrator — a senior operator who can bring structure, accountability, and execution across multiple business units while partnering directly with the CEO.

This role is not advisory. This is an execution\-focused leadership position.

**The Role**

The Fractional CBO will be responsible for turning vision into execution across the organization. You will work directly with the CEO to:

* Drive operational alignment across business units
* Establish KPIs, reporting cadence, and accountability
* Improve financial visibility and decision\-making
* Identify inefficiencies, gaps, and execution breakdowns
* Lead cross\-functional execution without micromanagement

This role is ideal for a seasoned operator who thrives in complex environments and is comfortable stepping into a fast\-moving, founder\-led organization.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Act as the Integrator between strategy and execution
* Establish and manage KPIs, dashboards, and weekly operating rhythms
* Partner with accounting/finance to improve financial reporting and clarity
* Identify operational bottlenecks and implement corrective actions
* Lead leadership meetings and ensure follow\-through on priorities
* Create structure without bureaucracy
* Hold leaders accountable while maintaining trust and alignment
* Provide weekly executive updates to the CEO

**What We’re Looking For**

* 10\+ years of senior operational leadership experience (COO, CBO, Integrator, President, or similar)
* Proven ability to operate across multiple business lines
* Strong financial and operational acumen
* Comfortable in founder\-led, high\-accountability environments
* Decisive, structured, and execution\-oriented
* High emotional intelligence and strong communication skills
* Ability to lead without ego and execute without micromanagement

Experience in real estate, multi\-entity organizations, or private equity\-backed environments is a strong plus.

**Engagement Structure**

* Fractional, 1099 engagement
* Initial 90\-day term
* On\-site presence preferred during onboarding
* Opportunity to transition into a full\-time executive role based on performance and mutual fit

**This Role Is NOT For You If**

* You are primarily an advisor or consultant
* You are uncomfortable making decisions
* You prefer highly structured corporate environments
* You avoid accountability or ambiguity

**Why This Opportunity**

This is a chance to help build the operational backbone of a growing enterprise, work directly with an engaged founder, and potentially step into a long\-term executive leadership role.

If you are an operator who enjoys building, fixing, and scaling — we want to talk.

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $6,000\.00 \- $8,000\.00 per month

Work Location: In person

jobs.title: Director of Finance
jobs.description:
**Controller / Director of Finance**

**Small Business \| DoD \& DHS Government Contractor**

**Location:** Northern Virginia / Hybrid  
**Reports To:** Chief Executive Officer

**Overview**

We are a growing small business government contractor supporting the **Department of Defense (DoD)** and **Department of Homeland Security (DHS)** seeking a **Controller / Director of Finance** to lead day\-to\-day financial operations. This is a hands\-on role responsible for accounting, government contract billing, compliance, and financial reporting in a regulated environment. The position works closely with the CEO and external advisors and has a clear growth path as the company scales.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Own monthly, quarterly, and annual financial close and reporting
* Manage government contract accounting, billing, and revenue recognition
* Ensure compliance with **FAR, DFARS, HSAR**, and **DCAA** requirements
* Track and maintain indirect cost rates and support pricing activities
* Support DCAA, DCMA, and DHS audits; maintain audit\-ready documentation
* Manage AP/AR, payroll, and cash flow monitoring
* Assist with annual budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis
* Coordinate with external CPA firms, auditors, and fractional CFO support

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
* 7\+ years of progressive accounting or finance experience
* **Government contracting experience required** (DoD and/or DHS preferred)
* Strong working knowledge of FAR/DFARS and DCAA audit processes
* Experience with government\-compliant accounting systems \- Deltek Costpoint
* Hands\-on, detail\-oriented, and comfortable in a small business environment

**Preferred**

* CPA or CMA certification
* Experience supporting cost\-plus, T\&M, and fixed\-price contracts
* Experience in a small business or high\-growth environment

**Compensation \& Benefits**

* **Bonus:** Performance\-based annual bonus opportunity
* **Benefits:** Competitive benefits package including health insurance, retirement plan, paid time off, and holidays

**Growth Opportunity**

This role offers a **clear path to expanded leadership responsibility**, including potential advancement to **Director of Finance or CFO** as the company grows in size and complexity.

**Security**

* U.S. Citizenship required
* Ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance (if required)

**Why Join Us**

* High\-impact role in a mission\-driven defense and homeland security contractor
* Direct exposure to executive leadership and strategic initiatives
* Opportunity to grow with the company and shape financial operations

**EOE\- GCI reviews all applicants for employment and gives preferential treatment to veterans.**

Pay: $120,000\.00 \- $130,000\.00 per year

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* accounting or finance: 7 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* CPA (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Washington, DC 20201

jobs.description:
***Are you a seasoned consultant or established leader with a strong professional network, and looking to scale your impact and recurring revenue?***

If you want to deliver meaningful transformation while generating flexible, high\-earning revenue, this strategic partnership may be an ideal fit.

This is not a traditional job. It is a performance\-based, high\-credibility partnership with Relationship Media, LLC, designed for senior professionals who want to help organizations rebuild trust, cohesion, and culture while creating meaningful income for themselves.

Founded by a 20\-year law enforcement veteran and former S.W.A.T. commander, our leadership system addresses one of today’s most urgent organizational challenges: The Relationship Gap, a $223B crisis of cultural disconnection affecting every sector.

Our training is practical, example\-driven, and immediately usable, anchored in our proprietary “Be Like Tony” and “Don’t Be Like Chad” leadership framework.

We provide the solution.  
You provide the relationships.  
Together, we equip leaders to rebuild culture, performance, and trust.

**The Strategic Opportunity: Certified Partner (Consultants / Coaches / Trainers)**  
We are selectively expanding a small, high\-level group of Certified Partners to bring this proven system to their networks and client base.

**This Opportunity Is Ideal For:**

* HR consultants, OD practitioners, leadership coaches, and boutique training firms.
* Consultants seeking a proven, high\-quality curriculum to expand their services with no additional fulfillment burden.

**As a Certified Partner, You Will:**

* Deliver our complete leadership curriculum under your own brand.
* Provide the training to your clients using our turnkey system.
* Retain a significant share of revenue.
* Add a scalable, recurring income stream without increasing hours.

This is a strong fit if you want to expand your offerings with a practical, high\-impact leadership system that produces measurable change and repeat business.

**Who Thrives in This Partnership**  
You may be an ideal partner if you are:

* An experienced consultant seeking a proven, credible system to expand your client impact.
* A retired or semi\-retired executive with trust\-based relationships and industry influence.
* A natural connector who understands the value of your network.
* Motivated by meaningful work, cultural transformation, and performance\-based income.

This partnership is designed for professionals who recognize that their relationships are their greatest asset.

**Next Step**  
If your background aligns with this strategic opportunity, we will follow up with details and schedule a brief, private conversation to assess mutual fit, opportunities, and next steps.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $1\.00 \- $500,000\.00 per year

Application Question(s):

* Do you understand this is not a direct hire/salary position?
* Are you willing to work with a performance\-based structure where compensation is based solely on your performance?

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Fractional Retail & B2B Expansion Lead (Contract / Part-Time)
jobs.description:
Smart Carts of Maine is one of the country's leading manufacturers of (1\) premium garden carts and utility carts, and (2\) premium cedar raised garden beds, planters, and outdoor furniture. Our products are sold direct\-to\-consumer and are increasingly gaining traction with professional users such as landscapers, garden centers, and institutional buyers.

Our products can be viewed on the below websites:

www.smartcarts.com

www.infinitecedar.com

We are seeking an experienced, hands\-on operator to help us build and execute growth through pallet programs targeting landscapers, garden centers, equestrian supply stores, marinas, and instructional buying channels— without adding heavy overhead or management layers.

**Role Summary**

We are hiring a **fractional, part\-time Retail \& B2B Expansion Lead** to own and execute our expansion into:

* Regional garden center chains
* Landscaper / contractor programs
* Select institutional buyers (equestrian supply stores, marinas, parks, campuses, etc.)

This is a **builder role**, not a “strategy\-only” position. You will be responsible for developing the programs, opening accounts, and creating repeatable processes that allow Smart Carts to scale without the founder becoming a bottleneck.

The role is ideal for someone who has:

* Led retail or B2B expansion at a small\-to\-mid\-sized consumer or durable goods company
* Strong relationships or experience with independent garden centers, regional chains, or pro customers
* A bias toward execution, not bureaucracy

**Responsibilities**

**Retail Expansion**

* Identify and prioritize regional garden center chains and independent store groups
* Lead outreach, pitch meetings, and line reviews
* Develop pilot programs (10–50 store tests)
* Negotiate wholesale pricing, terms, and seasonal buy\-ins
* Coordinate forecasting and launch timelines with internal operations

**Landscaper \& Contractor Programs**

* Design and launch a landscaper / pro customer program
* Define pricing tiers, minimums, and reorder cadence
* Build a simple outbound and inbound sales process
* Close initial anchor accounts and create repeatable playbooks

**Program \& Process Development**

* Help define a small number of “program SKUs” optimized for B2B and retail
* Build simple tools: pitch decks, one\-pagers, pricing sheets, reorder workflows
* Create a clear handoff process so accounts can be managed efficiently over time

**Collaboration**

* Work directly with the founder and operations team
* Provide clear feedback on pricing, packaging, and product\-market fit
* Recommend where additional investment (inventory, tooling, marketing) is justified by demand

**What This Role Is** ***Not***

* Not a big\-box national account executive role (yet)
* Not a people\-management role
* Not a strategy\-only advisory role
* Not a commission\-only sales job

This is a **hands\-on growth operator role**.

**Time Commitment**

* **10–20 hours per week**, flexible
* Remote\-friendly with potential occasional travel for key accounts (if needed)

**Compensation Structure**

We are intentionally designing this role to be affordable, performance\-aligned, and motivating.

**Path to expanded role** as volume grows (optional, not promised or required)

**Ideal Background**

* 7\+ years in retail sales, wholesale, or B2B expansion
* Experience with:
* Garden centers, outdoor products, tools, equipment, equestrian product sales, or durable consumer goods
* Regional retail chains and/or pro customer sales
* Comfortable selling products in the $200–$600 retail price range
* Entrepreneurial mindset; comfortable working without a large support team

**Why This Role Is Attractive**

* Real ownership of a growth function at an inflection point
* Direct impact on company scale and strategy
* High autonomy
* No corporate politics
* Clear upside if programs succeed
* Opportunity to grow with the business if mutually desired

Pay: $3,000\.00 \- $5,000\.00 per month

Benefits:

* Work from home

Application Question(s):

* Please provide a short note on your experience with retail, garden centers, or B2B programs
* Please share examples of accounts or channels you have helped launch or scale
* Please confirm that you are interested in a fractional / part\-time role

Experience:

* Sales: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

jobs.title: Director of Compliance (Fractional)
jobs.description:
**Director of Compliance (Fractional)**

  

Galt Pharmaceuticals is a purpose\-driven organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for patients by providing products that address unmet clinical needs. We empower entrepreneurs, support our employees, and make a positive impact in the communities we serve. We are seeking a highly motivated, self\-starting Director of Compliance to join our growing team!

 ***This is a part\-time (18\-20 hrs. per week) position. We provide a flexible and collaborative work environment with hybrid, coworking, and flex office space options! Our office is conveniently located in the Atlanta Metro area!***

 **Position Overview:**



Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer \& Co\-Founder, as the Director of Compliance, you will design, implement, and oversee Galt's ethics and compliance program, ensuring adherence to a dynamic landscape of federal, state, and international laws and regulations. This leadership role is critical to mitigating legal and financial risks, preventing misconduct, and promoting a strong culture of ethical conduct across the organization. In\-depth knowledge of FDA, OIG, EMA, DOJ, Medicare/Medicaid regulations and a strong understanding of healthcare laws such as the Anti\-Kickback Statute, False Claims Act, PDMA, GMP, GCP, and Sunshine Act is required. Candidates with contract management experience are encouraged to apply.

 **Responsibilities:**


* **Program Management:** Develop, execute, and continuously improve the corporate compliance program across all business units.
* **Risk Assessment \& Mitigation:** Identify compliance risks and vulnerabilities; conduct audits and reviews; develop corrective action plans; implement preventative strategies.
* **Regulatory Monitoring:** Stay abreast of evolving laws, regulations, and industry trends from regulatory bodies (FDA, EMA, DOJ, OIG, etc.) and industry codes (e.g., PhRMA Code). Ensure manufacturing and vendor relationships are compliant.
* **Policy Development:** Draft, update, and maintain compliance policies, SOPs, and the corporate code of conduct.
* **Training \& Communication:** Lead the development and delivery of compliance training for employees and third parties; foster a culture of compliance through clear, effective communication.
* **Internal Investigations:** Oversee or assist in investigations of potential compliance violations; document findings and ensure appropriate corrective action.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Serves as a liaison between outside counsel and/or consulting services; serves as a strategic partner and compliance advisor to senior management, legal counsel, medical and regulatory affairs, and cross\-functional teams; represent Galt during regulatory inspections and client audits.
* **Reporting:** Prepare and present reports on compliance activities, program effectiveness, and risk metrics to senior leadership and compliance committees.
* **Compliance and Administration:** Ensure contracts, programs, business initiatives comply with corporate policies, legal requirements, and industry regulations, and maintain organized records.
* Performs other duties, as assigned.

  


**Professional Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (science, law, business administration, or related discipline). Master's or JD preferred.
* Minimum 5 years experience in the pharmaceutical, healthcare, or biotech industry, with at least 3–5 years in a compliance leadership or managerial role.
* Pharmaceutical Compliance Certification (Certified Pharmaceutical Industry Professional (CPIP), Certified in Healthcare Compliance (CHC), or Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) Certified Professional, etc.) is preferred.
* Experience with federal reimbursement, discounts, rebates, and pricing is a plus.
* Proven leadership skills and experience managing teams and cross\-functional projects.
* Self\-starter with the ability to work independently and proactively with minimal supervision.
* Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated ability to translate complex regulations into clear policies and effective training.
* Strong analytical and problem\-solving abilities, particularly in risk assessment and solution development.
* High ethical standards and integrity, with the ability to build trust and credibility across all stakeholders.

  


**Employment Requirements:**


* Must pass a background check.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the United States.

  


**What's the Culture like at Galt?**

 **We're not your traditional pharmaceutical company! At Galt, our company culture is dynamic, employee\-focused, and entrepreneurial. We take pride in offering a career experience that makes you eager to come to work every day. Our environment is built on continuous improvement, fueled by collaboration and diverse perspectives, where challenging problems are solved together!**

 **At Galt, you'll find daily opportunities to learn, grow, and inspire those around you. You'll join a team of self\-starters, each motivated to make a real impact in every interaction. We value flexibility with work hours and understand the importance of life outside the office, empowering you to achieve your best both professionally and personally!**
